items.title: Test Issue for Tool Classification
items.body: This is a test issue to verify tool classification functionality.

items.title: Option to align files with folders and control indentation width in Explorer
items.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

In the File Explorer, the current indentation behavior has two limitations:
- Files and folders at the same level are not aligned horizontally (folders are slightly shifted compared to files).
- The indentation width between levels cannot be adjusted in a way that affects the Explorer tree consistently.

#Problems:
Visual inconsistency between files and folders makes directory structures harder to scan.
Some users prefer more or less indentation for readability, but the current workbench.tree.indent setting does not fully solve this for the Explorer.

#Proposal:
Add a setting (e.g., workbench.tree.alignFilesWithFolders) to ensure that files and folders at the same tree depth are aligned.
Improve or extend workbench.tree.indent so it reliably controls the horizontal indentation distance for each level in the Explorer tree.

Why this matters:
Consistent alignment improves readability and navigation in large projects.
Allowing users to customize indentation width supports accessibility and personal preference.
Makes the Explorer more flexible, on par with other editors and IDEs.

items.title: execute_prompt ignores mode and model in subprompts
items.body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates -->
<!-- Please attach logs to help us diagnose your issue -->

- Copilot Chat Extension Version: Latest Pre-release
- VS Code Version: Insiders - Latest
- OS Version: Windows 11
- Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode):
- Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): All
- Logs:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write a prompt that uses execute_prompt to call another prompt.
2. The mode and model that are used to call the original prompt will be used to call the subprompt. The subprompt's model and model are not respected.

items.title: Codespace disapeared
items.body:
Doing Harvard´s CS50 codespace. After week 7 (over 15 codefiles) it all disapeared. 
How do I restore it to a earlier point? Everything got pushed to Github, so I could start a new codespace and continue, but I cant. 
Trying to "Rebuild Codespace" in the top prompt, but it restores to the latest "failed" version (empty).

Read that Codespaces could get deleted after 30 days inactivity, but Ive used it almost every day...

Version: 1.104.1
Commit: 0f0d87fa9e96c856c5212fc86db137ac0d783365
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 
Embedder: codespaces

<!-- generated by web issue reporter -->

items.title: Terminal intellisense suggestions are useless
items.body: Type: Bug I'm running Visual Studio Code Internals. I've had to disable this as it's way worse than simply completing filenames. An example: I type make -f Ma and press tab... I need a filename completion, but instead it puts: make -f vscode_lsp_terminal_prompt_tracker Not sure where it gets 'scode_lsp_terminal_prompt_tracker' from... Some context specific AI training perhaps that doesn't apply? This happens all the time... I have a partial filename, expect completion and it gets replaced by something completely irrelevant for my context, I need to delete what was completed and type all my commands completely. I could disable this, so it's not an issue for me, just wanted to provide the feedback. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.105.0-insider (Universal) (50b5aa895467bcc17c91c9d2357f670969d4da3d, 2025-09-18T05:02:35.027Z) OS version: Darwin arm64 23.1.0 Modes:

items.title: Claude Opus 4.1 in VS Code Copilot Chat returns “Sorry, no response was returned” but differs from meta issue #253126 (Claude Sonnet 4 works fine in the same environment)
items.body: This issue appears related to [#253126](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/253126) (chat-no-response) but differs in the following ways: Claude Sonnet 4 works fine in the same environment. Quota is still deducted despite the failed response. - Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.31.2 - VS Code Version: 1.104.1 - OS Version: Windows 11 25H2 - Feature: ask mode - Selected model: Claude Opus 4.1 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open VS Code with GitHub Copilot Chat extension installed. 2. Sign in with a Copilot Pro+ account. 3. Select Claude Opus 4.1 from the model picker and confirm selection. 4. Enter a prompt that should return a multi‑paragraph answer. 5. Observe that the output is truncated and then displays “Sorry, no response was returned”. 6. Check quota usage — it decreases despite the failed response. Expected Behavior: Claude Opus 4.1 should return the full output without truncation or error, and failed responses should not consume quota. Actual Behavior: Output is truncated and then displays “Sorry, no response was returned”, and quota is still deducted. But Claude Sonnet 4 works fine in the same environment.

items.title: We should fetch models on account switch
items.body:
1. Be logged in VS Code with a GH Copilot with a Paid account. Notice how you get a lot of models in the dropdown
2. Log out, and login with a Free GH Copilot account
3. Notice that the model dropdown did not change 🐛  It changes on reload

Thus we should fetch and refresh model list on account login.

fyi @bpasero

items.title: Claude Opus 4.1 in VS Code Copilot Chat returns “Sorry, no response”, truncates output, and still deducts from my quota
items.body: - Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.31.2 - VS Code Version: 1.104.1 - OS Version: Windows 11 25H2 - Feature: ask mode - Selected model: Claude Opus 4.1 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open VS Code with GitHub Copilot Chat extension installed. 2. Sign in with a Copilot Pro+ account. 3. Select Claude Opus 4.1 from the model picker and confirm selection. 4. Enter a prompt that should return a multi‑paragraph answer. 5. Observe that the output is truncated and then displays “Sorry, no response was returned”. 6. Check quota usage — it decreases despite the failed response. Expected Behavior: Claude Opus 4.1 should return the full output without truncation or error, and failed responses should not consume quota. Actual Behavior: Output is truncated and then displays “Sorry, no response was returned”, and quota is still deducted. But Claude Sonnet 4 works fine in the same environment.

items.title: `DocumentRangeSemanticTokensProvider` has no support for `onDidChangeSemanticTokens`
items.body:
In contrast to the `DocumentSemanticTokensProvider` the `DocumentRangeSemanticTokensProvider` has no support for `onDidChangeSemanticTokens`. To allow refreshing semantic tokens for ranges as well support for `onDidChangeSemanticTokens` is need.

Original reported against LSP via the CSharp team (see https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/issues/1672)

items.title: Screen going blank when using dual screen
items.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.104.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Licensed

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open two windows of vs code (backend and frontend in my case) and if the first opened window remains idle in background for a couple of minutes sometimes seconds the screen will go blank. then minimize and maximize will solve the issue. (this keeps continuing)
2.

items.title: .ts files not automatically recognized as TypeScript
items.body: Why does the file with the .ts extension show the 'Select a language' link? In the picture below, isn't it clear that it's a TypeScript file since it has the .ts extension?

items.title: طلب دعم لتكامل ChatGPT مع نموذج توليد حملات تسويقية مخصص

labels.name: ai-translated
labels.description: issues translated by the classifier notebook llm

items.body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates -->
<!-- Please attach logs to help us diagnose your issue -->

- Copilot Chat Extension Version:
- VS Code Version:
- OS Version:
- Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode):
- Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet):
- Logs:

Steps to Reproduce:

1.أعمل على بناء منصة SaaS تعتمد على ChatGPT لتوليد حملات تسويقية تلقائية للمستقلين في مجال التسويق الرقمي. أحتاج دعمًا لتكامل واجهة ChatGPT مع نموذج إدخال مخصص يحتوي على الحقول التالية:

- اسم المنتج أو الخدمة
- الهدف التسويقي
- المنصة المستهدفة
- نبرة الرسالة

الهدف هو إرسال هذه البيانات إلى ChatGPT API والحصول على حملة تسويقية كاملة تشمل: نص الإعلان، أفكار الصور، جدول نشر، واقتراحات تحسين الأداء.

أرجو توجيهي لأفضل طريقة لتكامل هذا النموذج مع واجهة ChatGPT داخل VS Code أو عبر API خارجي، مع الحفاظ على الأداء والمرونة.

البيئة المستخدمة:
- OS: Windows 11
- Feature: ask mode
- Model: GPT-4.1

2.

items.title: Add Copy Error Message to IntelliSense mouse hover tooltip
items.body: This is something you can already do in the "PROBLEMS" tab at the bottom of VSCode like so: But what's annoying is that there is no such button when hovering directly over the error in code: And trying to copy the error from this tooltip / popup window is very annoying and finicky: When I select it and Ctrl+C, it almost never works. I have to select it, wait a few seconds, Ctrl+C, wait a few seconds and then move my mouse away to be certain the text got copied and I can paste it into Google. It would be nice if it had the same Copy Error Message button right there on the hover or whatever is causing the direct select/copy of the text to be finicky was fixed. Or both.
